item.title: 1 Don\'t Just Listen, Do
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 1 Don’t Just Listen, Do 13 October 1972 pm in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] INVOCATION OM, MAY THE SUN GOD GIVE US HIS BENEDICTION. MAY VARUNA, THE GOD OF WATER, GIVE US HIS BENEDICTION. MAY ARYAMA, INDRA, BRAHASPATI AND VISHNU GIVE US THEIR BENEDICTION.

item.title: 10 The Four Steps
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 10 The Four Steps 18 October 1972 am in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] THUS, THROUGH THE STATEMENTS LIKE TATTVAMASI, THAT ART THOU, TO PURSUE THE MEANINGS SUCH AS ONENESS OF JIVA, THE EMBODIED SOUL, AND BRAHMA, THE ABSOLUTE REALITY, IS SHRAVANA, THE LISTENING. AND TO REASONABLY PURSUE THE MEANING OF WHATEVER HAS BEEN LISTENED TO IS MANAN, CONTEMPLATION.

item.title: 11 The Soul\'s Thirst
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 11 The Soul’s Thirst 18 October 1972 pm in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] DURING SAMADHI, THE OBJECTS OF THE EXPERIENCES ARE NOT SEPARATE FROM THE SOUL, HENCE THEY ARE NOT EXPERIENCED. BUT THESE GLORIFIED EXPERIENCES OF THE SEEKER WHO HAS COME OUT OF SAMADHI ARE INFERRED THROUGH RECOLLECTIONS OF THE MIND.

item.title: 12 Die To The Future
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 12 Die To The Future 19 October 1972 am in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] WHEN NO DESIRE ARISES FOR OBJECTS WORTHY OF BEING ENJOYED, KNOW THIS AS THE LIMIT OF NONATTACHMENT. WHEN NO I-NESS ARISES, KNOW THIS AS THE LIMIT OF KNOWING. WHEN THE DISSOLVED DESIRES DO NOT ARISE BACK AGAIN, THIS IS THE LIMIT OF RELAXEDNESS, AND SUCH A STHITPRAGYA, A SEEKER, STABLE IN WISDOM, EVER REMAINS IN BLISS.

item.title: 13 Sweet Fruits
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 13 Sweet Fruits 19 October 1972 pm in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] ONE WHO NEVER KNOWS ANY DIFFERENCE THROUGH INTELLECT BETWEEN JIVA, THE EMBODIED SOUL, AND BRAHMA, OR BETWEEN BRAHMA AND NATURE, THE CREATION, IS CALLED A JIVANAMUKTA, THE ONE WHO IS LIBERATED WHILE LIVING.

item.title: 14 To Fly Is Your Birthright
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 14 To Fly Is Your Birthright 20 October 1972 am in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] KNOWING ONESELF AS UNATTACHED AND INDIFFERENT AS THE SKY, A YOGI IS NOT ATTACHED AT ALL AFTER THAT TO ANY FUTURE ACTIONS. JUST AS THE SKY PRESENT IN A POT FULL OF LIQUOR IS NOT AFFECTED BY THE SMELL OF THE LIQUOR, THE SOUL REMAINS UNTOUCHED BY ALL HAPPENINGS IN SPITE OF BEING PRESENT DURING ALL OF THEM.

item.title: 15 Wake Up! This is a Dream
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 15 Wake Up! This is a Dream 20 October 1972 pm in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] KARMA, PAST ACTIONS, BEAR FRUITS ONLY WHEN WE HAVE A FEELING OF MY-NESS FOR OUR BODIES. IT IS NEVER DESIRABLE TO HAVE A FEELING OF MYSELF FOR THE BODY.

item.title: 16 Only This Is!
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 16 Only This Is! 21 October 1972 am in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] IT IS NOT TO EXPLAIN TO THE KNOWERS BUT TO SATISFY THE IGNORANT THAT THE SCRIPTURES SAY THAT “BODY ETCETERA IS TRUE” AND THAT THERE IS ACCUMULATED KARMA, PAST ACTION.

item.title: 17 I Am This!
item.description: < Previous | Contents ‌CHAPTER 17 I Am This! 21 October 1972 pm in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] LISTENING TO THESE TEACHINGS FROM THE MASTER, THE DISCIPLE BECAME ENLIGHTENED AND BEGAN TO SAY: I HAD SEEN THE WORLD JUST NOW, WHERE HAS IT GONE? WHO HAS TAKEN IT AWAY? INTO WHAT HAS IT BECOME DISSOLVED?

item.title: 2 We Are In It!
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 2 We Are In It! 14 October 1972 am in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] INVOCATION IN THE CAVITY OF THE HEART, WHICH IS SITUATED WITHIN THE BODY, AN UNBORN ETERNAL LIVES. EARTH IS ITS BODY, IT DWELLS WITHIN THE EARTH, BUT THE EARTH DOES NOT KNOW IT.

item.title: 3 The Witness and The Illusion
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 3 The Witness and The Illusion 14 October 1972 pm in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] KNOWING ONESELF AS SAKSHI PRATYAGATMA, THE INNER WITNESSING SOUL, OF ONE’S INTELLECT AND ALL ITS DISPOSITIONS, AND ACQUIRING THE DISPOSITION THAT “THAT AM I,” GIVING UP THE CLAIM OF ‘MINE’ OVER ALL THINGS.

item.title: 4 Reflections In A Mirror
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 4 Reflections In A Mirror 15 October 1972 am in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] THIS BODY IS MADE FROM THE EXCRETA OF YOUR MOTHER AND FATHER AND IS FULL OF EXCRETA AND FLESH. THEREFORE, MOVING AWAY FROM IT, AS FROM A CHANDAL, THE LOWLY UNTOUCHABLE, AND BECOMING BRAHMA, THE ABSOLUTE REALITY, BE FULFILLED.

item.title: 5 Let Go and Fly
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 5 Let Go and Fly 15 October 1972 pm in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] ONLY A PERSON FREE FROM HOLDING ONTO THE EGO ATTAINS TO SELF-NATURE. THEREFORE, BECOMING SPOTLESSLY CLEAN LIKE THE FULL MOON, ONE BECOMES EVER BLISSFUL AND SELF-LUMINOUS. ON CESSATION OF THE SENSE OF DOING, ALL ANXIETIES CEASE.

item.title: 6 Life Is An Opportunity
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 6 Life Is An Opportunity 16 October 1972 am in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] ONE WHO HAS ATTAINED ONENESS WITH BRAHMA, THE ABSOLUTE REALITY, WHILE LIVING, WILL REMAIN SO EVEN AFTER LEAVING THE BODY. THEREFORE, O INNOCENT ONE! BECOMING AWAKENED BE VOID OF ALL CHOICE IN DUALITY.

item.title: 7 You Are The Knot
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 7 You Are The Knot 16 October 1972 pm in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] THE DELUSION OF THINGS BEING IN ONE’S SOUL IS AN IMPOSED PHENOMENON. DROPPING IT, ONE IS ONESELF THE PERFECT, NON-DUAL AND ACTIONLESS BRAHMA – THE ABSOLUTE REALITY. THE WORLD THAT APPEARS AS A DIFFERENT THING FROM THE SOUL IS ALMOST UNTRUE.

item.title: 8 Realize the Fruits
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 8 Realize the Fruits 17 October 1972 am in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] THE ROOT OF THIS DIVISION IS MIND. IF THERE IS NO MIND, THERE IS NO DIVISION. THEREFORE, CONCENTRATE YOUR MIND ON THE UNIVERSAL CONSCIOUSNESS WHICH IS YOUR INTERIORITY. KNOWING THAT YOU ARE THE PERPETUALLY BLISSFUL SOUL, ALWAYS REJOICE IN THIS BLISS WITHIN AND WITHOUT YOUR VERY SOUL.

item.title: 9 That \-- The Universal Religion
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 9 That – The Universal Religion 17 October 1972 pm in Mt. Abu, Rajasthan, India [NOTE: This is a translation of the Hindi series ADHYATMA UPANISHAD. This version is the final edit pending publication.] THE ONE WHO HAS THE ATTRIBUTE OF BEING THE EMBODIMENT OF MAYA, ILLUSION, WHO IS THE SOURCE OF THE UNIVERSE, WHO HAS THE CHARACTERISTICS OF OMNISCIENCE ETCETERA, AND IS THE EMBODIMENT OF INDIRECTNESS, MULTIPLICITY AND TRUTH ETCETERA, IS KNOWN BY THE WORD TAT – ‘THAT’.
